item.title: Ubisoft Posts Strong First-Half Growth And Teases Major Creative Shake-Up Coming In 2026
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

After a short delay, Ubisoft has posted its first-half earnings figures for 2025-2026. The company says that its Q2 net bookings exceeded expectations and its deal with Tencent to invest $1.2 billion in Vantage Studios--a new subsidiary focused on its three main franchises--is expected to close within a few days.

Ubisoft says that its Q2 net bookings were up 39% year-on-year, driven by stronger-than-expected performance across its games catalogue and TV projects. The company had initially predicted that it would reach $520 million for its quarterly books, but this figure increased to $566.7 million.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: Assassin's Creed Shadows: Claws of Awaji Launch Trailer

"Our portfolio showed contrasting dynamics this quarter, with softer trends for Rainbow Six Siege, reflecting a phase of evolution for the game in an intense FPS environment, offset by strong performances across the rest of the catalog. The Assassin’s Creed franchise exceeded our expectations, confirming its positive momentum and ability to engage players over time. The Division 2 also continued to perform strongly, benefiting from the momentum of the Battle for Brooklyn DLC," Ubisoft Yves Guillemot said in a press release.

The formation of a new operating model built around "Creative Houses" is still on track, and Ubisoft says that these will foster "stronger creative vision, greater focus, efficiency, autonomy and accountability" as it aims to finalize these plans by the end of the year. A full reveal of the new operating model will be unveiled in January 2026.

Looking ahead, Ubisoft is expecting its net bookings to remain stable year-on-year and it has forecast third-quarter net bookings of $352 million. After the initial date for Ubisoft's financial report was delayed, it was speculated that the company might have found a private buyer, similar to how EA sold itself to Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund, Jared Kushner's Affinity Partners, and the private equity firm Silver Lake.

CFO Frederick Duguet told staff in an internal email that the reason for the delay was so that Ubisoft could take "extra time to finalize the closing of the semester" and limit such "unnecessary" speculation. Ubisoft has gone through a turbulent time as of late, as the company reportedly canceled a Civil War-inspired Assassin's Creed game and Assassin's Creed creative lead Marc-Alexis Côté left Ubisoft in October. In the earnings report shared in July 2025, the company noted that revenues had continued to decline at the time.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: PS5-Exclusive Soulslike Stellar Blade Is Just $40
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

PlayStation's Black Friday 2025 sales have kicked off, and if you're looking to grow your PS5 library, then you'll want to check out this deal on Stellar Blade. Shift Up's action-RPG is on sale for $40, a big cut from its usual price of $70. The discount is available at Amazon, PlayStation Direct, Walmart, and Best Buy.

Stellar Blade

$40 (was $70)

The Stellar Blade standard edition includes the full base game.

Set in a future where humanity has been driven from Earth by the emergence of the Naytibas--hyper-aggressive monsters that can evolve into powerful forms and infect technology--Stellar Blade puts you in control of Eve, the last survivor of the 7th Airborne Squad, which was decimated before their operation could properly begin. Eve sets out to destroy the Elder Naytibas and reclaim Earth, while also carving a path forward through the Alpha Naytibas and their minions.

Stellar Blade features many elements that are similar to the Souls-like genre--from challenging boss fights to campsites that respawn monsters when you rest at them--but it also merges those mechanics with more traditional action game ideas, allowing you to increase Eve's power and skillset steadily along the way. Since launch, Stellar Blade has received numerous updates. Eve's wardrobe has been expanded with several new outfits, and paid DLC expansions have seen the crossovers with Nier: Automata and Goddess of Victory: Nikke.

If you're interested in checking out PlayStation's other Black Friday deals, be sure to check out the lists below. We've compiled a selection of our favorite deals--including discounts on PS5 console exclusives like Astro Bot, God of War Ragnarok, and Helldivers 2; big price cuts to Collector's Editions for Horizon Forbidden West, Death Stranding 2, and Marvel's Spider-Man 2; and price cuts for PS5 consoles, controllers, accessories, and more. And don't forget to check out GameSpot's Black Friday Deals Hub for even more holiday shopping sales beyond these PlayStation discounts.

item.title: Grab The Last Of Us Part 1 And 2 For Cheap Thanks To Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Last of Us has become one of the biggest franchises on PlayStation, and if you haven't checked it out yet, you can get the PS5 versions of The Last of Us Part 1 and The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered are on sale for $30 each during Black Friday. The Last of Us Part 1 normally costs $70 and The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered costs $50 at full price, meaning you're saving a total of $60 if you pick up both while they're on sale.

The Last OF Us Part 1

$30 (was $70)

The Last of Us Part 1 is a remake of the classic PS3 game that substantially updates its visuals while preserving its gameplay and story. While several quality-of-life features were introduced in this version, the core experience has been retained and is still an effective game that mixes action, exploration, and survival-horror themes together. In addition to the main campaign, this version of the game also includes the Left Behind prequel chapter, new weapons, upgrades, visual filters, and a Speedrun Mode.

The Last OF Us Part 2 Remastered

$30 (was $50)

The Last of Us Part 2 continues the story that began in the first game, and its PS5 edition is also a noticeable upgrade when compared to the original PS4 release. Graphical improvements and improved loading times on PS5 make for welcome improvements, and the game also features behind-the-scenes commentary from developers at Naughty Dog to show how several scenes were created, unlockable visual filters and cheat codes, Lost Levels that let you explore early-development versions of three levels not seen in the original game, and the fan-favorite Guitar Free Play mode for when you want to strum a few chords.

The other big addition was No Return, a roguelike survival mode that tests your skills against scavengers, bandits, and infected people in across a series of levels. The mode has since received several updates since it was first introduced, and it even includes an unlockable cosmetic inspired by Naughty Dog's next game, Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet.

If you've never played it, The Last of Us is set in a post-apocalyptic future, where society has collapsed after a mutated strain of the Cordyceps fungus has infected and turned most of the populace into rabid monsters. The first game explored themes of loss and redemption as protagonists Joel and Ellie trekked across the remains of the US, while the sequel is a brutal tale of revenge. Both games are among the most critically acclaimed titles on the PS5, thanks to their harrowing post-apocalyptic stories, which have been adapted into the ongoing The Last of Us TV series on HBO.

PS5 fans have plenty of other PlayStation Black Friday deals to take advantage of, including discounts on games, collector's editions, controllers, and more. You can even grab a PS5 Pro or PS5 Slim at decent discounts if you're looking to dive into the console's library for the first time. Browse a selection of the best PS5 Black Friday deals below, or head over to GameSpot's Black Friday Deals Hub to see the latest discounts on video games and other categories like Blu-ray, Legos, collectibles, and more.

item.title: God Of War Ragnarok Is Just $20 For A Limited Time
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

This year marks the 20th anniversary of the God of War franchise, and one of the best ways to celebrate is to grab the latest entry in the long-running series, God of War Ragnarok, which is down to its lowest price yet for Black Friday. You can grab the game for just $20 (was $70) at Amazon, PlayStation Direct, and Walmart for a limited time. If you want to go all out, you can pair the discounted game with the limited-edition God of War 20th Anniversary DualSense controller, which is also getting a Black Friday price cut to $65 (was $85).

God of War Ragnarok

$20 (was $70)

The sequel to 2016's critically acclaimed God of War, Ragnarok continues the Nordic tale of Kratos and his son Atreus as they battle vengeful gods and explore the realms. Considered one of the quintessential PS5 games, Ragnarok combines cinematic storytelling with engrossing gameplay as Kratos carves a path forward to prove that destiny can be defied.

This deal is for the standard edition of the game, which includes the full base game on the disc. You can also access the free Vallhalla downloadable expansion, which adds a roguelite mode built around Ragnarok's action-packed gameplay that serves as an epilogue to the main game.

Many other PS5 games and DualSense controllers are discounted for Black Friday. Some notable offers include the massive Horizon Forbidden West Collector's Edition for just $30 (was $180) and the Marvel's Spider-Man 2 Collector's Edition for $130 (was $230). You can also grab Astro Bot for $40 and Death Stranding 2 for $50. Both games also have their own special edition DualSense controllers that are discounted during Black Friday. Check out all these deals and more below, then head over to GameSpot's Black Friday Deals Hub to see even more price cuts to video games, Blu-rays, Legos, and more.

item.title: Bring Democracy To The Alien Hordes With This Helldivers 2 PS5 Black Friday Deal
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

One of the biggest recent hits on PS5 has been Helldivers 2, a game best described as an online, PvE multiplayer third-person shooter with a satircal tone that melds Starship Troopers with Warhammer 40,000. If you haven't yet enlisted in Super Earth's war machine, you can finally join the fight with this Black Friday deal on the game, as it's down to $30 (was $40) for the sales event. This is a great excuse to check out the multiplayer shooter if you've been interested--and might be a good opportunity to convince a few friends to pick up the game and group up, too. This limited-time deal is available at Amazon, PlayStation Direct, and Walmart.

Helldivers 2

$30 (was $40)

Helldivers 2 has a simple but engaging premise. As one of Super Earth's defenders, it's up to you to bring the concept of Managed Democracy to worlds infested with vile alien species and marauding machines. How do you spread the good word? With guns, bombing runs, and well-placed tactical nuclear strikes deep in the heart of enemy territory. An always-online game, Helldivers 2 can be played solo or with fellow soldiers, and it receives constant updates that add new weapons to your arsenal and shiny cosmetics to collect.

Helldivers 2 sets itself apart in the live-service game genre by adopting a novel spin on in-game currencies. While you'll regularly earn rewards from successful missions and for taking part in community events, the premium in-game currency can also be earned simply by playing the game. While it does take longer than simply swiping your credit card and buying the resources, you can get everything that Helldivers 2 has to offer if you don't mind grinding away for it. Luckily, the game's battle passes don't expire, and you can unlock what you want from it when you want it, provided that you have enough points saved up.

While it's multiplayer-only, the game's playerbase is large and active, and it's still easy to find others to play with, even over a year later. Even better, developer Arrowhead doesn't plan to stop supporting the title anytime soon, as it envisions it as a forever game like the legendary Runescape, so it appears Helldivers 2 will be around for quite a while.

item.title: Death Stranding 2 Collector's Edition & DualSense Get Limited-Time Holiday Discounts
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Several of the biggest PS5 games are on sale for Black Friday, with Death Stranding 2: On the Beach being one of the big highlights. Fans can save $100 on the Death Stranding 2 Collector’s Edition, which is down to $130 (was $100) has also gotten a big price cut and is on sale for $130, down from $230. This bundle gets you the full game, a selection of bonus digital content, and several physical collectibles including figures of Magellan Man and Dollman, a letter from game director Hideo Kojima, and more. If that's too expensive, you can also grab the physical Death Stranding 2 standard edition for just $50 (was $70). In addition to these game deals, the Death Stranding 2 Special Edition DualSense PS5 controller is also discounted to $65 (was $85).

Death Stranding 2: On the Beach Collector's Edition

$130 (was $230)

The Collector’s Edition for Death Stranding 2: On the Beach features a selection of digital and physical items. It comes with a digital download code for Death Stranding 2, a 15-inch statue of Magellan Man inside the collector’s box, a three-inch Dollman figurine on a keychain loop, art cards, and a letter with a message from Hideo Kojima. The digital extras include early in-game unlocks for weapons, equipment, and cosmetics.

Death Stranding 2: On the Beach DualSense Controller

$65 (was $85)

The Death Stranding 2 DualSense controller is also on sale, and this was designed in partnership with Kojima Productions. It has a sleek black finish and insignia based on the fictional Drawbridge company that appears in the sequel, orange accents, and the “Death Stranding 2” logo on the back. On the controller touchpad you’ll find the motto of Drawbridge: "Both stick and rope, to protect and connect. Together, from tomorrow."

A direct sequel to 2019’s Death Stranding, Death Stranding 2: On the Beach continues the story of Sam Porter Bridges as he works to reunite the scattered cities of Earth following a cataclysmic event that left humanity on the edge of extinction. Directed by Hideo Kojima, the game also features a cinematic presentation, with several characters modeled on and voiced by Hollywood celebrities, including Norman Reedus, Guillermo del Toro, and Elle Fanning.

If you're looking to fill out your PS5 collections, you'll want to check out the many other PlayStation Black Friday deals available now. You can grab big discounts on standard editions of PS5 exclusives like Astro Bot, God of War Ragnarok, and Gran Turismo 7, or pick up Collector's Editions of Marvel's Spider-Man 2, Horizon Forbidden West, and Ghost of Yotei, all of which are at least $100 off. You'll also find deals on limited edition DualSense controllers based on many of these games, including Astro Bot, God of War Ragnarok, and Ghost of Yotei. We've collected some of our favorite PlayStation Black Friday deals in the list below. Once you've checked those out, give GameSpot's Black Friday Deals Hub a look to see even more holiday discounts on everything from video games and Blu-rays to Legos, figures, and beyond.

item.title: DualSense Limited Edition PS5 Controllers On Sale For Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The PlayStation Black Friday Sale is live now at PlayStation Direct and select major retailers, including Walmart, Best Buy, and Amazon. It's once again time to take advantage of the rare opportunity to buy stylish new DualSense Wireless Controllers for well below retail price. And this year's iteration of the sale is unique thanks to flurry of limited-edition PS5 controllers introduced in recent months.

PS5 Limited Edition DualSense Controller Black Friday Deals:

  • God of War 20th Anniversary -- $64 ($85)
  • Astro Bot Joyful -- $64 ($85)
  • Icon Blue -- $64 ($85) | Walmart Exclusive
  • Ghost of Yotei (Gold) -- $64 ($85)
  • Ghost of Yotei (Black) -- $65 ($85) | PS Direct Exclusive
  • Ghost of Yotei PS5 Slim Bundle (Black) -- $500 ($600) | PS Direct Exclusive
  • Ghost of Yotei PS5 Slim Bundle (Gold) -- $499 ($600)
  • Death Stranding 2: On the Beach -- $65 ($85) | PS Direct Exclusive
  • Fortnite -- $65 ($85)

You can also get the Ghost of Yotei editions with the PS5 Slim Ghost of Yotei Console Bundle, which is on sale for $100 off during the holiday sale.

  • See DualSense Deals at: Amazon | PS Direct | Walmart | Best Buy | Target

All DualSense colors and themes are eligible for a $20 discount, including the new Astro Bot Joyful, God of War 20th Anniversary, Ghost of Yotei with gold or black accents, the Walmart-exclusive Icon Blue, and the Death Stranding 2 model. PlayStation's 2025 holiday sale runs through December 18, but it's possible some of these DualSense Controllers will be gone before then. PlayStation's sale also includes the premium DualSense Edge in white and Midnight Black for $170 (was $200). If you're looking to buy DualSense Controllers at Amazon, it usually takes Amazon a bit to adjust all of its prices, but some were live at the time of writing.

We created lists of each DualSense Controller at Walmart and Amazon, followed by a gallery with images and details about each Limited Edition as well as related products like matching PS5 Console Covers, Collector's Editions, PS5 Slim Console Bundle deals. All orders placed at PlayStation Direct come with free standard shipping.

DualSense Controller Deals at Walmart:

  • Astro Bot Joyful -- $64 ($85)
  • Icon Blue -- $64 ($85) | Exclusive
  • God of War -- $64 ($85)
  • Ghost of Yotei Gold -- $64 ($85)
  • Chroma Indigo -- $59 ($80)
  • Chroma Pearl -- $59 ($80)
  • Chroma Teal -- $59 ($80)
  • Cobalt Blue -- $59 ($80)
  • Volcanic Red -- $59 ($80)
  • Sterling Silver -- $59 ($80)
  • White -- $54 ($75)
  • Midnight Black -- $54 ($75)
  • Gray Camouflage -- $54 ($75)
  • Starlight Blue -- $54 ($75)
  • Cosmic Red -- $54 ($75)
  • Galactic Purple -- $54 ($75)
  • DualSense Edge (White) -- $169 ($200)
  • DualSense Edge (Black) -- $169 ($200)

DualSense Controllers at Amazon

  • God of War -- $64 ($85)
  • Ghost of Yotei Gold -- $65 ($85)
  • Astro Bot Joyful -- $64 ($85) | Sold out
  • Chroma Indigo -- $59 ($80)
  • Chroma Pearl -- $59 ($80)
  • Chroma Teal -- $60 ($80)
  • Cobalt Blue -- $59 ($80)
  • Volcanic Red -- $59 ($80)
  • Sterling Silver -- $59 ($80)
  • White -- $54 ($75)
  • Midnight Black -- $54 ($75)
  • Gray Camouflage -- $54 ($75)
  • Starlight Blue -- $54 ($75)
  • Cosmic Red -- $54 ($75)
  • Galactic Purple -- $54 ($75)
  • DualSense Edge (White) -- $169 ($200)
  • DualSense Edge (Black) -- $170 ($200)

Ghost of Yotei Limited Edition Gold DualSense Controller

$64 (was $85)

The gold-accented Ghost of Yotei edition is sold at all major retailers and launched alongside the game on October 2. PlayStation Direct is sold out, but you can find it in stock at Amazon, Walmart, and Best Buy.

This controller also comes bundled with the Ghost of Yotei Limited Edition PS5 Slim Bundle, which is on sale for $100 off in PlayStation's Black Friday sale. The bundle comes with a PS5 Slim with a disc drive, the DualSense shown above, a matching console cover, and a digital copy of Ghost of Yotei.

Ghost of Yotei PS5 Slim Gold Bundle - $499 ($600)

  • Amazon
  • PS Direct
  • Walmart
  • Target
  • Best Buy

If you already own a PS5 Slim and want to make your own Ghost of Yotei-themed console, the Ghost of Yotei PS5 Slim Console Cover is discounted to $50 (was $65) at PS Direct.

Fortnite Limited Edition DualSense Controller

$65 (was $85)

The Fortnite Limited Edition DualSense is only in stock at two retailers: PlayStation Direct and Target. At the time of writing, only PS Direct has the deal. The chaotic design launched last fall and has remained in stock longer than any other Limited Edition DualSense (by a wide margin).

DualSense Controllers: Chroma Collection

$59 (was $80)

The Chroma Collection launched last winter with three vibrant colors with iridescent paint, which creates a shimmering effect. Chroma Indigo, Pearl, and Teal editions retail five bucks higher than the standard DualSense controllers.

Matching PS5 Slim Console Covers for the Chroma Indigo and Pearl DualSense are on sale at PlayStation Direct.

PS5 Slim Chroma Console Covers

  • Chroma Indigo -- $50 ($65)
  • Chroma Pearl -- $50 ($65)

DualSense Edge Controller: White

$169 (was $200)

Both editions come with the following components:

  • Two pairs of swappable paddles
  • Three pairs of stick caps: standard, tall dome, low dome
  • Trigger locks with three stopping points
  • Two customizable Function buttons for menus/settings
  • Braided USB-C cable with optional connector housing
  • Hardshell carrying case

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
